content:
Some proposals (implemented in the latest version of the Patients First Terminology Server - Terminz)

http://nzmt.org.nz
http://health.govt.nz/read-codes
http://health.govt.nz/ethnicity-codes-level-1
http://health.govt.nz/ethnicity-codes-level-2
http://health.govt.nz/ethnicity-codes-level-3
http://health.govt.nz/ethnicity-codes-level-4

perhaps: http://health.govt.nz/fhir/NamingSystem/nhi might be more acceptable? with other national systems being under the same "http://health.govt.nz/fhir/NamingSystem" root...

but being resolvable seems to me to be an advantage...
(whether or not there is a 'NamingSystem' in the path ...)

Note this proposal from Lloyd...

Might be worth commenting on...

I've made a couple of comments. The one regarding the naming convention is probably the most significant, because some Naming System Identifiers need to be immutable and that might require some thought if (as is recommended) FHIR versioning is handled via endpoint addressing.
yeah - that's probably the trickiest part of this...
